title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research (Book Bolt Tutorial 2023)

tactics.name: Book Bolt Keyword Filtering
tactics.description: Use Book Bolt to identify keywords with high search volume and low competition by skipping to lower search volume pages (e.g., ~4,000) and analyzing Amazon competition results.
steps: Search Book Bolt with broad keywords (e.g., 'coloring book')
Filter to pages with ~4,000 monthly search volume
Check Amazon competition results for low competition
Analyze top sellers for title/description trends
caveats: High search volume keywords may still face intense competition
source_quotes: 'anything above 5 6,000 sometimes the competition can be really really crazy'

tactics.name: Competitor Analysis
tactics.description: Analyze similar products using Publisher Rocket to identify keyword trends and competition
steps: Search for keywords in the 'products' section
Check keyword counts and related keywords
Review product descriptions and A+ content
caveats: When keyword competition is too high
source_quotes: you can put in the keyword and the category so again uh snake into there for coloring book

tactics.name: Niche Review Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate customer feedback to identify content preferences and avoid common pitfalls
source_quotes: look at the reviews because the reviews is going to give you what people like about the book

heuristics.name: Search Volume vs. Competition Balance
heuristics.condition: If search volume exceeds 4,000 and competition is under 1,000, prioritize the keyword

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords with high engagement
source_quotes: people always tend to Reby them whether it's Coloring Books

claims.statement: Top-selling coloring books often include 'flowers' in titles despite not being strictly flower-themed
source_quotes: 'you're seeing a lot of colorful stuff'

claims.statement: Medium-content books generate passive income through repeat purchases
source_quotes: it turns to passive income which is I think what we're all kind of after here

niche_patterns.example: coloring books + flower motifs + specific demographics
niche_patterns.description: Leverage trending terms (e.g., 'flowers') in niche markets with lower competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines broad search volume with specific audience targeting
source_quotes: 'see a lot of these are including flowers in the title'

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with unique constraints
source_quotes: people will Reby the same type of book from someone else as long as it's good
